title: Grade 4
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

4C5FCFEA081D4B8CACA74F4D6D4AAE01.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 4 Reading Standards to informational
texts (e.g., use reasons and evidence supporting point in an
informational text) (EE.L.4.9b).

ADD764A01E1945CA8C93A68F153F4BD1.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 4 Reading Standards to literature
(e.g., use details from text to describe a character in a story) (EE.L.4.9a).

35078A32E10E410CA80D0B14D5956A49.description:
Recall information from literary and informational text to support writing
(EE.L.4.9).

B921F2334CD5449FA233A0DF2FABD08B.description:
Recall and sort information from personal experiences or a topic into given
categories (EE.L.4.8).

BED0C6EAA7924CADA113D26351927D00.description:
Gather information about a topic from two or more sources for a research
project (EE.L.4.7).

C073BB2DCFFC4E0195486E2C828465C1.description: With guidance and support students can:

A5A2B751965C4AB5BE5A11105F88E0A9.description: Use a variety of resources to build and communicate knowledge related to open-ended research questions.

2FFFD3CFD503421B8CEA51D0F8A9C71D.description: Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences (EE.L.4.10).

3C0AF2B7F3964A36921E20781C71FCE2.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the
Internet, to produce writing while interacting and collaborating with others
(EE.L.4.6).

DF82ECA2DB9946609ABBEA19ED151C5D.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, plan before writing and
revising own writing (EE.L.4.5).

8482A1CC35E84800B99C38DA703F91B3.description: Produce writing that expresses more than one idea (EE.L.4.4).

799260C47A6E40F4A234258AF855F3D5.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating (EE.L.4.3).

00CD235587B94D8CBBDDF15F1F895F75.description:
Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of letter-sound
relationships, and/or common spelling patterns (EE.L.4.2d).

80241D0430444AAD8E5DA1AA121C80E3.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence (EE.L.4.2a).

7A51F7BC0E6348F99BA2CB7B9662B531.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English (EE.L.4.2).

13FA20A457C84789B6605E1D8FA192B7.description: Combine three or more words in communication (EE.L.4.1f).

EE789DE7F414488E9E57128B491DAD72.description:
Use common prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, by, with)
(EE.L.4.1e).

A088A0016B2A49099A4BB2650F897506.description:
Use comparative and superlative adjectives to describe people or
objects (EE.L.4.1d).

7CCD9CAFAF8D4582B932DB525716FE52.description:
Combine common nouns with verbs, nouns, or pronouns in
communication (EE.L.4.1b).

A35C08F1A40A4AE7A77B499C1C52EB9E.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage when communicating
(EE.L.4.1).

7CD3BE94C0964C65A273615E65D86DC6.description: With guidance and support students can:

F242173158E64EAE9F116AD90CF4ABDD.description: Understand why and how writers use the conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to clarify their meaning.

9B8017911B67468FBAA017010070564E.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from a narrated experience or event.

508419C62EDA44739E4F00F9C25AE1CB.description:
Use words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and
events.

A759AE7A40FD45CE9BF2355692816CDA.description: Use transitional words first, next, last to order a sequence of events.

E77F9EEB52F2476AB7151F5CBC45467B.description: List reasons to support an opinion (EE.W.4.3b).

1FCDC5DE0C34417AA45180ED53401F8F.description:
Write about a personal experience including two events in sequence
(EE.W.4.3a).

45ACFD02CD674BD3A141A97EDEEF84F7.description: Write about events or personal experiences (EE.W.4.3).

C5F22E6EF5FC474E904B465FB2DE6FAA.description: With guidance and support students can:

32D9DACD016E43149B30F82EAA97F72D.description: Write engaging, real or imagined narratives using descriptive details and dialogue to convey a sequence of related events.

89A9441BEB1546FEB16AFB852753BA27.description:
Provide a concluding statement or sentence related to the information or
explanation presented.

E57BF2945BA14E65B41387932BF97246.description:
Use increasingly precise language and domain-specific vocabulary over time
to inform about or explain a variety of topics.

16D52B0A8A2F4300AD41B2D7374ADED0.description:
Link ideas within categories of information, appropriately using words and
phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

7D1A110F2129461EB3849B0F9785EE85.description: List words, facts, or details related to the topic (EE.W.4.2b).

479E6E7026B146E384CCD27B681E89CB.description:
Organize relevant ideas and details to convey a central idea or prove a
point.

EB1198DB1E8D45F4B36167B950A8D3EE.description:
Identify a text structure appropriate to purpose (e.g., sequence, chronology,
description, explanation, comparison and contrast).

37F69632C8044885A1C98598A9777689.description:
Select a topic and write about it including related visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate (EE.W.4.2a).

32BFD87723244FE09FD56E66279D4D5B.description: With guidance and support students can:

6A83A364CB1A4FCAAEABEDEB00B4C089.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts using text structures appropriate for the purpose and developed through facts, definitions, concrete
details, precise language, and domain-specific vocabulary.

235C629D4D8E42B3A3828332CFAE6FB7.description:
Provide a concluding statement or sentence related to the opinion
presented.

63A47420513944B08FD4F3DF7724F546.description:
Create an organizational structure that lists opinion and reasons in a logical
order.

2AF9A955E24741A18C048508C19C76DF.description: List reasons to support the opinion (EE.W.4.1b).

6CFC87E7221B409893420BA316FC994D.description: Select a topic or text and write an opinion about it (EE.W.4.1a).

C3DDCC6004A44EFB9B7ABF730E31AD15.description: Write opinions about topics or text (EE.W.4.1).

005D43270AA64070A70F671C58C122C5.description: With guidance and support students can:

852874C7F0A24CB6B3DABA3D13F539D9.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts supporting a point of view with reasons and information. (CCSS: W.4.1)

677F66B297C745C2907FD23FCE044A55.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities including domain-specific words (EE.L.4.6).

8D3D853F182746BA97592318729BB8A2.description: Use common idioms (e.g., no way, not a chance, you bet) (EE.L.4.5b).

B85D9B4AA04F46D5A00E043FF7BC56E4.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use (EE.L.4.5).

47BB413D66A240B2A4E57AF37D3BACA6.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., talk) and the words that
result when word endings are added (e.g., talked, talking, talks)
(EE.L.4.4b).

80506E42BE834AAF99912A2AF55CD767.description:
Use context as a clue to guide selection of a word that completes a
sentence read aloud by an adult (EE.L.4.4ba).

375557C6B64147239F00D14292C2B064.description:
Use letter knowledge and context to support word recognition when
reading (EE.RF.4.4c).

CB1992E65D4443369B43620489552F3B.description:
Read text comprised of familiar words with accuracy and understanding
(EE.RF.4.4a).

15D63A13303941C295631B879EEF7220.description:
Decode single-syllable words with common spelling patterns
(consonant-vowel-consonant [CVC] or high frequency rimes)
(EE.RF.4.3b).

6B1F42A36C6141158F47353B7EFD6B16.description:
Apply letter-sound knowledge to use first letter plus context to identify
unfamiliar word (EE.RF.4.3a).

488012CEEA474B009500EC8D537AA197.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words (EE.RF.4.3).

E185481AC1E8467D864F44FFD8789A94.description: With guidance and support students can:

BF41E305EB054172B5DE5C3FF299C034.description:
Apply knowledge of spelling patterns (orthography) and word meanings (morphology) to decode multisyllable words and determine the
meaning of unknown words.

EBFA6E213FCE41B6A50CFFC95634D2C4.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while actively engaged in shared
reading of history/social studies, science, and technical texts (EE.RI.4.10).

03F3885BE0E24F79AF9E574FE6467E03.description: Compare details presented in two texts on the same topic (EE.RI.4.9).

E50913817160433F87E7BDFA543C7729.description:
Identify one or more reasons supporting a specific point in an
informational text (EE.RI.4.8).

C59F547A2DE44053809CC1DA974F87D8.description:
Answer questions about information presented visually, orally, or
quantitatively (EE.RI.4.7).

A3A4FFCAF96646CBBE01C610C1E24158.description:
Compare own experience with a written account of the experience
(EE.RI.4.6).

D9B6FAE4827D4C04B55DDAA60A1F8A9E.description:
Identify elements that are characteristic of informational texts
(EE.RI.4.5).

AEE240CF3BA04BE69FF564DE7057B176.description: Determine meanings of words in text (EE.RI.4.4).

C142758E74C843F883B716595EAE72CE.description: Identify the main idea of a text when it is explicitly stated (EE.RI.4.3).

C7B017E306D6484FAEE79045C7864CC8.description: Identify the main idea of a text when it is explicitly stated (EE.RI.4.2).

817FA9258D2048E2ACD82CE107C22F9F.description: Identify explicit details in an informational text (EE.RI.4.1).

0EE763AF909848F8A0A12A24FE0CFF75.description: With guidance and support students can:

A51E6FFB9EB942F8BE49B61CBB25985B.description: Apply strategies to comprehend and interpret informational texts.

A0E23EBB06BC4E3D8CF1F8CB445BA78B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while actively engaging in shared
reading of stories, dramas, and poetry (EE.RL.4.10).

9451055531D0458B8FF1E30AC619B2E0.description:
Compare characters, settings or events in stories, myths or texts from
different cultures (EE.RL.4.9).

F4BA53448F9F4BF4BB015CAD586B48EF.description:
Make connections between the text representation of a story and a visual,
tactual, or oral version of a story (EE.RL.4.7).

3DFB18D85AB943C0B037FBB3749864AD.description: Identify the narrator of a story (EE.RL.4.6).

93A5FA20C5B843CFB9E3E4C865C3A3D2.description: Identify elements that are characteristic of stories (EE.RL.4.5).

9A335FB36F6D4B35B8D6B96DA01D157B.description: Determine the meaning of words in a text (EE.RL.4.4).

DB08AA8E25FA4F6CA3D1DA2C7FB54357.description: Identifies the central conflict and resolution in a story.

743A257515A34654BE0E914E0C85F2C7.description: Use details from the text to describe characters in the story (EE.RL.4.3).

9B5F76BFDB7D48EB950CFCD47C88AA18.description:
Identify the theme or central idea of a familiar story, drama or poem
(EE.RL.4.2).

4894B49F587443ED816C6C58AC225685.description: Use details from the text to recount what the text says (EE.RL.4.1).

2CCC170B42CC4C0FA164B23E500FDC72.description: With guidance and support students can:

A7D4FC586FE9447E8A3D713D68813145.description: Apply strategies to comprehend and interpret literary texts.

115140F0D22E46F496CC164E06C43BA9.description:
Differentiate between communication partners and contexts that call for
formal and informal communication (EE.SL.4.5).

0629A74D49714C65BA0F81B72E428259.description:
Add audio recordings or visuals to make a presentation about a personally
relevant topic (EE.SL.4.5).

CA617CFD84694857A2FFC71724FB05FF.description:
Retell a story or personal experience or recount a topic with supporting
details (EE.SL.4.4).

5E734200DC564EF884A0965F0F94334F.description: With guidance and support students can:

8B925CF7055E4BBDBF81DEC8E7CC8275.description: Create a plan to effectively present information both informally and formally.

0D0C401E37594254B2045D2A3793BFA3.description: Identify a point that the speaker makes (EE.SL.4.3).

DCAFAD433E37421293189DC27F63623A.description:
Ask and answer questions about details from a text read aloud or
information presented orally or through other media (EE.SL.4.2).

14E028C4099C45BA987EAC1C8DCBF3B1.description: Identify the key ideas in a discussion (EE.SL.4.1d).

3A9AB305C87D4B9FB7E3416293203071.description:
Answer specific questions related to information in a discussion
(EE.SL.4.1c).

2987AD1D9AA34E7FA927EDFE71016519.description: Carry out assigned role in a discussion (EE.SL.4.1b).

F2E6987FBD3747A4BCF98CDA0867D593.description:
Contribute ideas from prior knowledge of a text during discussions
about the same text (EE.SL.4.1a).

B55466B3E0DB4599B3A51E6F76253338.description: With guidance and support students can:

E28E6977AF724F188A5CCDADDEC6B46E.description: Pose thoughtful questions after actively listening to others.
